III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & Rule 400.4112 Criminal history check, subject to
Section requirements; staff qualifications.
Description (4) A person with ongoing duties shall have both of the following:
(a) Ability to perform duties of the position assigned.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Staff 1 threatened to burn down the facility and "tried to fight" an
unidentified youth.
Investigation I notified the Foster Care Worker, who is also the Complainant,
that DCWL was assigned this complaint. No additional concerns
were expressed.
Vista Maria Open Residential (Myriam Hall) is a non-secure
treatment facility. The youth attend a charter school on campus
and have part-time jobs in the community.
I interviewed Youth M jointly with Government Worker 1 on 3/6/23.
Youth M admitted she did not hear Staff 1 say she would burn
down the building, but she heard this from another youth. She did
not say which youth she heard it from. On 3/2/23 Youth M said
Youth D did not want to be wanded with the metal detector after
school and ran toward Staff 1. “Staff 1 put her keys down and
was angry.” Youth D said she and Youth A got between Youth D
and Staff 1.
2

Youth A refused to be interviewed by investigators.
I interviewed Youth D jointly with Government Worker 1. She
displayed a tough excitable demeanor. Youth D said on 3/2/23,
“Me and Staff 1 was going back and forth because we was getting
wanded. I asked a question. Staff 1 acted like she was gonna run
up on me.” Youth D clarified, “She got into my personal space.
Staff 2 grabbed Staff 1. Staff 1 told Youth K she’d burn the place
down and that she has a place to go but the youth don’t. Staff 1
and I got into it before…We told Staff 3 that Staff 1 said she’d burn
the place down and told Staff 3 not to tell Staff 1 what we said.
Staff was a team together. Staff 3 told Staff 1 and it escalated.
The whole house got upset. I filed a grievance and Rights Officer
addressed it.”
I interviewed Youth K jointly with Government Worker 1. She
calmly stated, “Staff 1 never said she’d burn this to the ground and
never tried to fight a youth. There’s no problem with Staff 1.
Youth D was aggressive toward her.”
I interviewed Youth J jointly with Government Worker 1. She
made statements about the staff in general. “They walk up on us,
get in our personal space,” threaten to enforce rules and
recommend a more restrictive environment. Youth J said she was
not present, but Youths K, A and D heard Staff 1 say she would
burn the facility. This was not corroborated by Youths K, A or D.
I interviewed Case Manager jointly with Government Worker 1
with Rights Officer present. She said on 3/2/23, “We wanded kids
because keys were missing. Staff 1 was matter of fact. Youth D
was cussing and upset. She (Staff 1) passed the want to me.
Youth D was threatening to ‘cut up.’ I know Staff 1 did not say that
she’d burn down the facility or the rest of it. Staff 1 did not walk up
on Youth D or get in her personal space. It was the reverse. Youth
D walked toward Staff 1 in an aggressive manner.”
I interviewed Staff 2 jointly with Government Worker 1 with Rights
Officer present. She said on 3/2/23 Staff 1 wanded the youth after
school looking for missing keys. Youth D was opposed to being
wanded and resisted, cussed, and complained about it. Youth D
came toward Staff 1 threatening, “Bro, I’m gonna beat your ass.”
“Staff 1 stood up. They were ten feet apart. Staff 1 asked Youth
D to stop acting like a toddler. Youth D got pissed off.” Staff 2
denied Staff 1 threatened to burn the facility down or that the
youth do not have a home.
3

I interviewed Staff 1 jointly with Government Worker 1 with Rights
Officer present. She has worked for Vista Maria for 12 years.
Government Worker 1 read the allegations aloud. Staff 1 said
Myriam Hall staff do not typically wand youth after school, but on
3/2/23, a school staff’s keys were missing. “We explained to the
youth why we needed to wand them. Youth D was the only girl
with a problem saying, ‘F that.’ I asked, ‘Why are we acting like a
toddler?’ Youth D became enraged, yelling and walked toward
me…I went to the office and sat for a minute before I got off (work)
at 3:30pm.”
Staff 1 denied threatening to burn the facility down. She said she
has known Youth D for five years and that Youth D is known for
name-calling and verbally threatening staff.
Government Worker 1 did not substantiate maltreatment in care.
Analysis Youth and staff witnesses did not corroborate the allegations.
There is no evidence Staff 1 does not have the ability to perform
her job duties.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
